title: Gyakorító igék (-ag/-eg/-ög)
sentences: The clock is ticking quietly on the wall.
The fire is crackling cheerfully in the fireplace.
The brook is gurgling quietly in the forest.
The train is rushing/rolling loudly on the rails.
The old wagon is bumping along on the dirt road.
The window is rattling quietly in the wind.
The fresh snow is crunching under my feet.
The coffee maker is puffing/breathing loudly.
The bees are buzzing around the flowers.
The dog is growling angrily at the stranger.
The flag is fluttering proudly in the wind.
The distant thunder is rumbling quietly.
The water is sparkling in the sunshine.
The patient is whimpering quietly in the bed.
The phone is whirring/vibrating quietly on the table.
The dry leaves are rustling quietly on the trees.
The car's wheel is clattering on the asphalt.
The children are giggling in the back row.
I often jog in the park in the mornings.
The old man is grumbling under his breath.
The distant lamp's light is flashing rhythmically.
The water is sloshing quietly in the bottle.
My heart is beating fast from the excitement.
The old machine is puffing/chugging in the factory.
The curtain is swaying softly by the window.
The old floor is creaking at every step.
The mud is squelching loudly under my boots.
The wood is popping/crackling in the stove.
The breeze is rustling quietly in the reeds.
dictionary:
Kattog - Ticking
Pattog - Crackling
Csobog - Gurgling
Robog - Rolling/Speeding
Döcög - Bumping
Zörög - Rattling
Ropog - Crunching
Szuszog - Puffing
Zümmögnek - Buzzing
Morog - Growling
Lobog - Fluttering
Dübörög - Rumbling
Csillog - Sparkling
Nyöszörög - Whimpering
Berreg - Whirring
Zizegnek - Rustling
Csattog - Clattering
Vihognak - Giggling
Hömpölyög - Rolling (water)
Kocogok - I am jogging
Dörmög - Grumbling
Villog - Flashing
Kotyog - Sloshing
Dobog - Beating
Pufog - Puffing/Chugging
Libeg - Swaying
Recseg - Creaking
Cuppog - Squelching
Durrog - Popping
Suhog - Rustling
